body:
Comment 3 by **vincent-google@vinc17.net**: 
Well, http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Constants is about constants, but the spec
does not say that constant expressions are evaluated using this internal
representation (I would have thought that some mix of FP and exact (e.g. rational)
arithmetic was used). So, the spec is clearly lying when it says that "Constant
expressions are always evaluated exactly". I propose the following two changes in the
spec:

1. Under http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Constant_expressions
   "exactly" should be replaced by "in high precision".

2. Under http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Constants
   replace "A compiler may implement numeric constants" by "A compiler may implement
numeric constants and evaluate constant expressions".
